shortdesc.span: Several profiling attributes can be aggregated into a profiling condition set that allow you to apply more complex filters on the document content. A Profiling Condition Set is a very powerful and convenient tool used to preview the content that goes into the published output. For example, an installation manual available both in Windows and Linux variants can be profiled to highlight only the Linux procedures for more advanced users.

XML Schema
topic.shortdesc: In order to provide as-you-type validation and to compute valid insertion proposals, Oxygen XML Author needs an XML grammar (XML Schema, DTD, or RelaxNG) associated to the XML. The grammar specifies how the internal structure of the XML is defined.

topic.title: CSS Stylesheet
topic.shortdesc: A set of rules must be defined for describing how the XML document is to be rendered in Author mode. This is done using Cascading Style Sheets (CSS). CSS is a language used to describe how an HTML or XML document should be formatted by a browser. CSS is widely used in the majority of websites.

topic.title: The XML Instance Template
topic.shortdesc: Based on the XML Schema and CSS file Oxygen XML Author can help the content author in loading, editing, and validating the test reports. An XML file template must be created, which is a kind of skeleton that the users can use as a starting point for creating new test reports. The template must be generic enough and reference the XML Schema file and the CSS stylesheet.

The oxy_local-name() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_local-name() function evaluates the local name of the current node.

topic.title: The oxy_name() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_name() function evaluates the qualified name of the current node.

topic.title: The oxy_url() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_url() function extends the standard CSS url() function by allowing you to specify additional relative path components (parameters loc_1 to loc_n).

topic.title: The oxy_base-uri() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_base-uri() function evaluates the base URL in the context of the current node.

topic.title: The oxy_parent-url() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_parent-url() function evaluates the parent URL of an URL received as string.

topic.title: The oxy_capitalize() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_capitalize function capitalizes the first letter of the text received as argument.

topic.title: The oxy_uppercase() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_uppercase() function transforms to upper case the text received as argument.

topic.title: The oxy_lowercase() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_lowercase() function transforms to lower case the text received as argument.

topic.title: The oxy_concat() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_concat() function concatenates the received string arguments.

topic.title: The oxy_replace() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_replace function is used to replace a string of text.

topic.title: The oxy_unparsed-entity-uri() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_unparsed-entity-uri() function returns the URI value of an unparsed entity name.

topic.title: The oxy_attributes() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_attributes() function concatenates the attributes for an element and returns the serialization.

topic.title: The oxy_substring() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_substring() function is used to return a string of text.

topic.title: The oxy_getSomeText(text, length) Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_getSomeText(text, length) function allows you to truncate a long string and to set a maximum number of displayed characters.

topic.title: The oxy_indexof() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_indexof() function is used to define searches.

topic.title: The oxy_lastindexof() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_lastindexof() function is used to define last occurrence searches.

topic.title: The oxy_xpath() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_xpath() function is used to evaluate XPath expressions.

topic.title: Form Controls
topic.shortdesc: Oxygen XML Author provides a variety of built-in form controls that allow users to interact with documents with familiar user interface objects.

topic.title: The Text Field Form Control
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_textfield built-in form control is used for entering a single line of text in a graphical user interface box. A text field may include optional content completion capabilities, used to present and edit the value of an attribute or an element.

topic.title: The Combo Box Form Control
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_combobox built-in form control is used for providing a graphical user interface object that is a drop-down menu of proposed values. This form control can also be used for a combination of a drop-down menu and an editable single-line text field.

topic.title: The Check Box Form Control
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_checkbox built-in form control is used for a graphical user interface box that you can click to enable or disable an option. A single check-box or multiple check-boxes can be used to present and edit the value on an attribute or element.

topic.title: The Pop-up Form Control
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_popup built-in form control is used to offer a contextual menu that provides quick access to various actions. A pop-up form control can display single or multiple selections.

topic.title: The Button Form Control
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_button built-in form control is used for graphical user interface objects that invokes a custom Author mode action (defined in the associated Document Type) referencing it by its ID, or directly in the CSS.

topic.title: The Button Group Form Control
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_buttonGroup built-in form control is used for a graphical user interface group of buttons that invokes one of several custom Author mode actions (defined in the associated Document Type) referencing it by its ID, or directly in the CSS.

topic.title: The Text Area Form Control
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_textArea built-in form control is used for entering multiple lines of text in a graphical user interface box. A text area may include optional syntax highlight capabilities to present the form control.

topic.title: The URL Chooser Form Control
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_urlChooser built-in form control is used for a dialog box that allows you to select the location of local or remote resources. The inserted reference is made relative to the URL of the currently opened editor.

topic.title: The Date Picker Form Control
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_datePicker built-in form control is used for offering a text field with a calendar browser that allows to choose a certain date in a specified format.

topic.title: The HTML Content Form Control
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_htmlContent built-in form control is used for rendering HTML content. This HTML content is displayed as a graphical element shaped as a box. The shape of the box is determined by a given width and the height is computed based upon the length of the text.

topic.title: Implementing Custom Form Controls
topic.shortdesc: If the built-in form controls are not sufficient for your needs, you can implement custom form controls in Java.

topic.title: Editing Processing Instructions Using Form Controls
topic.shortdesc: Oxygen XML Author allows you to edit processing instructions, comments, and CDATA by using the built-in editors.

topic.title: The oxy_action() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_action() function allows you to define actions directly in the CSS, rather than referencing them from the associated framework.

topic.title: The oxy_action_list() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_action_list() function allows you to define a list of actions directly in the CSS, rather than referencing them from the associated framework.

topic.title: The oxy_label() Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_label() function can be used in conjunction with the CSS content property to change the style of generated text.

topic.title: The oxy_link-text() Function
topic.shortdesc: You can use the oxy_link-text() function on the CSS content property to obtain a text description from the source of a reference.

topic.title: The oxy_unescapeURLValue(string) Function
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_unescapeURLValue() function returns the unescaped value of an URL-like string given as a parameter.

topic.title: Arithmetic Functions
topic.shortdesc: Arithmetic Functions are supported.

Extending Oxygen XML Author Using the SDK
Extending Oxygen XML Author with Plugins
General Configuration of an Oxygen XML Author Plugin
Workspace Access Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: This plugin type allows you to contribute actions to the main menu and toolbars of Oxygen XML Author, to create custom views and interact with the application workspace, make modifications to opened documents and add listeners for various events.

topic.title: JavaScript-based Workspace Access Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: This is a JavaScript-based plugin extension that allows you to contribute actions to the main menu and toolbars of Oxygen XML Author, create custom views, interact with the application workspace, make modifications to opened documents, and add listeners for various events.

topic.title: Option Page Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: This extension type allows developers to add custom preference pages to the application Preferences dialog box.

topic.title: Components Validation Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: This plugin type allows the developer to customize the editor menus, toolbars, and other components by allowing or filtering them from the user interface.

topic.title: Custom Protocol Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: This type of plugin allows the developer to work with a custom designed protocol for retrieving and storing files.

topic.title: Resource Locking Custom Protocol Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: This plugin type allows the developer to work with a custom designed protocol for retrieving and storing files. It can lock a resource on opening it in Oxygen XML Author. This type of plugin extends the custom protocol plugin type with resource locking support.

topic.title: XML Refactoring Operations Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: This plugin type allows the developer to specify one or more directories from which the XML Refactoring operation resources are loaded.

topic.title: Open Redirect Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: This type of plugin is useful for opening more than one file with only one open action.

topic.title: Targeted URL Stream Handler Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: This type of plugin can be used when it is necessary to impose custom URL stream handlers for specific URLs.

topic.title: Lock Handler Factory Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: This type of extension is used for locking resources from a specific protocol.

topic.title: StylesFilter Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: This plugin type allows the developer to dynamically modify the CSS styles used to render elements in the Author mode.

topic.title: Plugin Extensions Designed to Work only in the Text Editing Mode
General Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: This plugin type allows the developer to invoke custom code and to interact with the workspace of Oxygen XML Author.

topic.title: Selection Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: A selection plugin can be applied to both an XML document and a non-XML document. It works as follows: the user makes a selection in the editor, displays the contextual menu, and selects the item corresponding to the plugin from the Plugins submenu.

topic.title: Document Plugin Extension
topic.shortdesc: This plugin type can be applied only to an XML document. It can modify the current document which is received as callback parameter.

topic.shortdesc: Functionality is common with the standalone distribution of Oxygen XML Author, as they share the same options. This allows you to configure a consistent editing experience for all users.

topic.title: Customizing WebApp Component Frameworks
topic.shortdesc: Custom documentation frameworks can be re-used between the Oxygen XML Author standalone distribution and the WebApp Component.

topic.title: Customizing WebApp Component Plugins
topic.shortdesc: The WebApp Component server side can be customized with a variety of plugin types.

topic.title: Customizing WebApp Component Client Side
topic.shortdesc: Client side customization is available through a JavaScript API. Unlike the server side customization, it can be used to modify the application's GUI.

Additional Notes About the Merge Operation
Create Patch from Local Modifications
topic.shortdesc: This is the most commonly used type of patch and contains only the local changes for the selected item.

topic.title: Create Patch Against a Specific Revision
topic.shortdesc: This type of patch contains changes between an old revision and the current content from the selected item within the working copy.

topic.title: Create Patch Between Two Revisions of an Item
topic.shortdesc: This type of patch contains historical changes between two revisions of a selected item.

topic.title: Create Patch Between Two Repository Items
topic.shortdesc: This type of patch contains changes between one version of an item and a specific version of another item.

topic.title: Create Patch Between Two Revisions of an Item
topic.shortdesc: This type of patch contains historical changes between two revisions of a selected item.

topic.title: Create Patch Between Two Repository Items
topic.shortdesc: This type of patch contains changes between one version of an item and a specific version of another item.
